hotelapp

Class Review

  • java.lang.Object
    • hotelapp.Review
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Review>

    public class Review
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Review>
    The class stores information about one hotel review. Stores the id of the review, the id of the corresponding hotel, the rating, the title of the review, the text of the review, the date when the review was posted in the following format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss Also stores the nickname of the user who submitted this review, and whether the user recommends the hotel to others or not. Implements Comparable - reviews should be compared based on the date (more recent review is considered "less" that the older one). If the dates are the same, compares reviews based on the user nicknames alphabetically. If the user nicknames are the same, compares based on the review id.

      • Review

        public Review(java.lang.String hotelId,
              java.lang.String reviewId,
              int rating,
              java.lang.String reviewTitle,
              java.lang.String review,
              boolean isRecom,
              java.lang.String date,
              java.lang.String username)
       throws java.text.ParseException,
              InvalidRatingException
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        hotelId - - id of the hotel that is being reviewed
        reviewId - - id of the review
        rating - - integer rating from 1 to 5
        reviewTitle - - the title of the review
        review - - text of the review.
        isRecom - - boolean, whether the user recommends it or not
        date - - date of the review in the format yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss
        username - - the nickname of the user writing the review. If empty, save it as "Anonymous"
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - - If date is not valid.
        InvalidRatingException - - If the rating is out of the correct range from MINREVIEW TO MAXREVIEW

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Review other)
        Compares this review with the review passed as a parameter based on the dates (more recent date is "less" than older date). If the dates are equal, it compares reviews based on the user nicknames, alphabetically. If user nicknames are the same, it compares based on the review ids. Note that we only care about comparing reviews for the same hotel id.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Review>
        Parameters:
        other - review to compare this one with
        Returns:
        -1 if this review is "less than" the argument, 0 if equal 1 if this review is "greater" than the other one

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a string representation of this review. Use StringBuilder for efficiency.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string in the following format: Review by username on date Rating: rating reviewTitle textOfReview Example: Review by Ben on Tue Aug 16 18:38:29 PDT 2016 Rating: 2 Very bad experience Awaken by noises from top floor at 5AM. Lots of mosquitos too. If the username is null or empty, print "Anonymous" instead of the username
